short_summary: The Department of National Defence (DND) requests contractors to bid for a contract to replace the air conditioning and ventilation system, which involves upgrading the central air handling units (CAHUs) to address noise issues and relocate the chillers. The system will be designed to meet ASHRAE 170-1989 standards. The contract will last 124 days, with a performance period of 1 year. The work will be performed at Canadian Forces Base Trenton in Ontario. The Department of National Defence will provide a detailed contract description and a comprehensive scope of work. This solicitation is for a commercial-off-the-shelf replenishment contract, and bids received by fax or email will be accepted as official. The contract description and scope of work will be available on the Buy and Sell section of the Public Works and Government Services Canada website.

full_summary:
### Tender Announcement for Stage 1 - Kwisitis Visitor Centre Plumbing Fixtures Replacement

#### Tender Reference and Contract Details

* Tender Reference Number: CB 271-72172284
* Solicitation Number: 5P468-23-0296 / A
* Amendment Number: 5
* Tender Publication Date: January 22, 2024
* Tender Closing Date: February 6, 2024 at 16:00:00
* Expected Contract Start Date: March 1, 2024
* Expected Contract End Date: May 21, 2024
* Contract Status: Expired

#### Scope of Work

* Replacement of twenty-one (21) plumbing fixtures in the visitor washroom facilities at the Kwisitis Visitor Center in Pacific Rim National Park Reserve
* Value of the project: estimated to be between $100,001 and $250,000, all taxes included
* Work must be completed by May 21, 2024

#### Tendering Process

* This is a two-stage selection process
* Interested suppliers must submit their qualification submissions in Stage One
* Qualified suppliers will receive an Invitation to Tender (ITT) for Stage Two, where they will provide a financial bid on the project
* Parks Canada reserves the right to negotiate with suppliers on this procurement
* The Crown retains the right to award a contract to the lowest qualified bidder

#### Important Information

* Suppliers must submit their bids via fax or email as indicated in the solicitation document
* Bids received in-person or by courier will not be accepted
* Suppliers must use the email address `soumissionsami-bidsrpc@pc.gc.ca` to submit their bids
* The maximum email file size that Parks Canada can receive is 15 megabytes
* Suppliers must attach their bid documents to their email submissions, rather than providing links to the documents

#### Technical and Contractual Enquiries

* Enquiries regarding this solicitation must be submitted in writing and received no later than five business days prior to the tender closing date
* Suppliers are responsible for reviewing the National Park Act and other relevant legislation before submitting their bids
* Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada, and Parks Canada has made every effort to provide equivalent documents in both languages. However, if any discrepancies are found, please notify the Contracting Authority listed in this opportunity.

For further information, please download the solicitation documents from the Government of Canada's Tendering Service website at [insert link]. Bidders are responsible
